questions.text: In fetal alcohol syndrome, which of the following is not seen? (AIIMS NOV 2017)
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Macrocephaly

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Fetal Alcohol Syndrome (FAS) is associated with microcephaly and other CNS abnormalities, but macrocephaly is not a feature of this condition.

questions.text: A woman came to OPD with a newborn who has complaints of chest retractions, dyspnea, and lethargy. The paediatrician diagnosed the baby with respiratory distress syndrome. This occurs due to the deficiency of: (NEET PG 2023)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Lecithin

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Respiratory distress syndrome in newborns is primarily caused by a deficiency of surfactant, particularly lecithin (dipalmitoyl phosphatidylcholine).

questions.text: What is the rate of increment of head circumference in the first three months of life? (INICET MAY 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The head circumference of a baby increases by approximately 2 cm per month during the first three months of life.

questions.text: A 4-year-old child was brought to the hospital with a history of loose stools. No history of fever or blood in stools. The mother says he is irritable and eagerly drinks water if given. On examination, eyes are sunken and in the skin pinch test, the skin retracted within two seconds but not immediately. What treatment is advised for the child? (AIIMS MAY 2017)

options.label: A
options.text: Give oral fluids and zinc supplementation only and ask mother to come back if danger sign develops.

options.label: B
options.text: Give oral fluids and ask mother to continue the same and visit again the next day.

options.label: C
options.text: Consider severe dehydration start IV fluids, IV antibiotics, and refer to higher centre.

questions.correct_answer: A. Give oral fluids and zinc supplementation only and ask mother to come back if danger sign develops.
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Give oral fluids and zinc supplementation only and ask mother to come back if danger sign develops

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In a child with some dehydration, the recommended treatment includes oral rehydration therapy, zinc supplementation, and continued breastfeeding, with instructions to return if danger signs develop.

questions.text: A 7-year-old girl is evaluated by her pediatrician due to decreased urine output. She weighs 22 kg and measures 115 cm tall. Laboratory tests show a blood urea level of 50 mg/dL and a serum creatinine of 0.8 mg/dL. To assess her kidney function, her doctor plans to calculate the estimated glomerular filtration rate (eGFR) using the Schwartz formula. What is the calculated eGFR for this child?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) 60 mL/min/1.73 m²

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The Schwartz formula is commonly used to estimate eGFR in pediatric patients. It takes into account the child's height and serum creatinine. For children aged 1 to 16 years, the constant k is 0.413. Accurate calculation of eGFR helps in assessing kidney function and determining the severity of renal impairment.

questions.text: An 8-day-old newborn was found to have thyroid -stimulating hormone level of more than 100 mlU/L. Which of the following will be the next best investigation? (NEET PG 2022)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Radiotracer uptake with technetium

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Radiotracer uptake with technetium is the next best investigation to confirm the presence and function of the thyroid gland in a newborn with elevated TSH.

questions.text: A baby is brought to OPD for 10-week DPT vaccination appointment. He previously experienced a fever exceeding 40°C and had an inconsolable cry at 6 weeks old after receiving a vaccination. What would be the recommended course of action moving forward? (INICET MAY 2023)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Give DT vaccine

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Severe reactions (such as high fever >40.5°C, persistent inconsolable crying >3 hours, or hypotonic-hyporesponsive episodes) after a previous DPT dose are indications to withhold the pertussis component in future doses. The child should receive the DT vaccine instead.

questions.text: Which of the following is not an indicator of fetal lung maturity? (AIIMS MAY 2018)

options.label: D
options.text: Nile blue test showing >50% of blue cells

questions.correct_answer: D. Nile blue test showing >50% of blue cells
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Nile blue test showing >50% of blue cells

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The presence of more than 50% orange cells in the Nile blue test indicates fetal lung maturity, whereas more than 50% blue cells suggest immaturity.

questions.text: A child has features of meningitis with following CSF examination: protein=93, glucose=20, Lymphocytes + Diagnosis? ( INICET Nov 2023)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Tubercular meningitis

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Recognize the CSF findings associated with different types of meningitis. Understand that the CSF profile, including elevated protein, decreased glucose, and lymphocytic pleocytosis, can be indicative of tubercular meningitis. Be aware of the various etiologies and clinical presentations of meningitis in pediatric patients.

questions.text: A child transfers an object from one hand to another. What does it signify? ( INICET MAY 2020)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Ability to compare objects

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Transferring an object from one hand to another in a child signifies their developing ability to compare objects, a cognitive milestone typically reached around 5.5 to 6 months of age.
  • ➤ Developmental Milestones in 1 st Yr of Life
  • ➤ Developmental Milestones in 1 st Yr of Life

questions.text: Which one of the following is not a feature in cerebral palsy? (NEET PG 2019)
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Flaccid paralysis

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Flaccid paralysis is not a feature of cerebral palsy; it is indicative of lower motor neuron disease. Cerebral palsy is characterized by various forms of muscle tone abnormalities and movement disorders.

questions.text: A 2-year-old child presents with delayed motor development, mental retardation, and finger biting. Initially normal at birth, the child later develops cerebral palsy, arthritis, and dies from renal failure at age 25. Which enzyme deficiency is most likely? (AIIMS NOV 2016)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C. HGPRT deficiency

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Lesch-Nyhan syndrome, caused by HGPRT deficiency, leads to hyperuricemia, self-mutilative behavior, and neurological symptoms, often resulting in severe complications like renal failure.

questions.text: Which can be used as an alternative to breast milk in low birth weight (LBW) child? (INICET MAY 2022)
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Human donor milk

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Human donor milk is the alternative to breast milk in low birth weight infants

questions.text: A 2-day-old neonate was admitted to the NICU after he was observed to have movements as shown in the image. His APGAR scores were 8 and 9 at 1 and 5 minutes, respectively. His blood sugar was within the normal range in the first 24 hours. What is the likely diagnosis? (AIIMS NOV 2018)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Focal clonic seizure.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Focal clonic seizures in neonates involve repetitive, rhythmic contractions of muscle groups that are resistant to restraint and can be unifocal or multifocal.

questions.text: Choose the most appropriate answer: (INICET NOV 2022) Assertion: In phenylketonuria, the urine has a mousy odor. Reason: The serum levels of tyrosine, dopamine, and norepinephrine are decreased in phenylketonuria.

options.label: A
options.text: Both assertion and reason are independently false statements.

options.label: B
options.text: The assertion is independently a true statement, but the reason is independently a false statement.

options.label: C
options.text: Both assertion and reason are independently true statements, but the reason is not the correct explanation for the assertion.

options.label: D
options.text: Both assertion and reason are independently true statements, and the reason is the correct explanation for the assertion.

questions.correct_answer: C. Both assertion and reason are independently true statements, but the reason is not the correct explanation for the assertion.
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Both assertion and reason are independently true statements, but the reason is not the correct explanation for the assertion.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In phenylketonuria, the mousy odor of urine is due to the accumulation of phenylacetate, while decreased levels of tyrosine and catecholamines are a result of the impaired conversion of phenylalanine to tyrosine. However, the two phenomena are not causally related.

questions.text: A child with infantile hypertrophic pyloric stenosis has multiple episodes of non-bilious vomiting. Which of the following metabolic abnormalities is likely to be seen in this condition? (NEET PG 2021)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Hypochloremic, hypokalemic alkalosis

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Infantile hypertrophic pyloric stenosis leads to hypochloremic, hypokalemic metabolic alkalosis due to persistent vomiting and loss of gastric acid.

questions.text: Which of the following are components of kangaroo mother care? ( INICET MAY 2021)

options.label: A
options.text: Early discharge, skin to skin contact, prevent infection

options.label: B
options.text: Early discharge, skin to skin contact, exclusive breastfeeding

options.label: C
options.text: Skin to skin contact, exclusive breastfeeding, prevent infection

options.label: D
options.text: Early discharge, exclusive breastfeeding and prevent infection

questions.correct_answer: B. Early discharge, skin to skin contact, exclusive breastfeeding
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Early discharge, skin to skin contact, exclusive breastfeeding.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Kangaroo Mother Care (KMC) involves skin-to-skin contact, exclusive breastfeeding, and early discharge, focusing on the care of low birthweight infants.

questions.text: An 18-month-old baby was brought to the hospital with complaints of poor feeding and abnormal twitching of his lower limb. On examination, he has fever with fontanelle bulging and the child was lethargic. The most probable cause is: (AIIMS MAY 2019)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Meningitis

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Poor eating, fever, convulsions, a bulging fontanelle, and lethargy are all symptoms of meningitis.

questions.text: Which of the following are causes of neonatal seizures? (INICET NOV 2021) Hyponatremia Hypomagnesemia Hypocalcemia Hypernatremia
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) 1, 2, 3 and 4

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Neonatal seizures can be caused by various metabolic disturbances, including hyponatremia, hypomagnesemia, hypocalcemia, and hypernatremia, and these should be considered in the differential diagnosis of seizures in neonates.

questions.text: The procedure displayed below is? (AIIMS NOV 2019)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Orogastric tube insertion.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Orogastric tube insertion involves placing a tube through the mouth into the stomach and is used for rehydration and nutritional support in pediatric patients, particularly those with dehydration or severe illness.

questions.text: Which of the following is not a criteria for severe acute malnutrition? (INICET NOV 2020)

options.label: A
options.text: Weight for height less than -3 SD

options.label: D
options.text: Weight for age less than -3 SD

questions.correct_answer: D. Weight for age less than -3 SD
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Weight for age less than -3 SD

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Severe acute malnutrition is defined by weight-for-height less than -3 SD, MUAC < 115 mm, or the presence of bilateral pedal edema, but not by weight-for-age less than -3 SD.

questions.text: A newborn is found to have hepatomegaly during a routine examination, with no other significant findings. Investigations reveal positive Anti-HCMV antibodies. What long-term condition is this child at risk for? (AIIMS NOV 2016)
questions.explanation:
Ans. D. Sensorineural hearing loss

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Asymptomatic congenital CMV infection significantly increases the risk of developing sensorineural hearing loss later in life.

questions.text: Two girls in the same class are diagnosed with meningococcal meningitis. Their 12-year-old friend from the same school is afraid of contracting the disease. What advice should be given to the exposed students? (NEET PG 2020)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Antibiotic prophylaxis

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ For immediate protection after exposure to meningococcal meningitis, antibiotic prophylaxis is necessary. Vaccination is also recommended but does not provide immediate protection.

questions.text: A 1-day old neonate presented with scaphoid abdomen, respiratory distress and mediastinal shift. All of the following can be done except? (INICET NOV 2023)
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Bag and mask ventilation

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Recognize the clinical signs of diaphragmatic hernia, such as a scaphoid abdomen, respiratory distress, and mediastinal shift. Understand the appropriate interventions, including oxygen administration, positive pressure ventilation, endotracheal intubation, and the limitations of bag and mask ventilation in specific clinical scenarios.

questions.text: A child presents with cold feet and a history of wearing socks even in the summers. On examination, lower limb pulses are diminished as compared to the radial pulse. Prominent radio femoral delay is present. What is the underlying condition? (INICET NOV 2022)

options.label: A
options.text: There is hypertrophy of ductus arteriosus.

options.label: B
options.text: Coarctation distal to the origin of the left subclavian artery

options.label: C
options.text: Supply is from posterior to anterior thoracic artery.

options.label: D
options.text: Collaterals develop to supply upper limb.

questions.correct_answer: B. Coarctation distal to the origin of the left subclavian artery
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Coarctation distal to the origin of the left subclavian artery

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Coarctation of the aorta typically presents with cold feet, diminished lower limb pulses, and radiofemoral delay due to a narrowing of the aorta distal to the origin of the left subclavian artery.

questions.text: Drug resistance is seen in which of the following STDs: (INICET MAY 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Gonorrhea

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Neisseria gonorrhoeae, the causative agent of gonorrhea, has developed resistance to multiple antibiotics, including penicillin and fluoroquinolones, making third-generation cephalosporins the current treatment of choice.

questions.text: Which of the following is true about red blood cells in Sickle cell anemia: (INICET NOV 2023)

options.label: A
options.text: Low mechanical fragility, high osmotic fragility

options.label: B
options.text: High mechanical fragility, high osmotic fragility

options.label: C
options.text: Low mechanical fragility, low osmotic fragility

options.label: D
options.text: High mechanical fragility, low osmotic fragility

questions.correct_answer: D. High mechanical fragility, low osmotic fragility
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) High mechanical fragility, low osmotic fragility

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Sickle cells exhibit high mechanical fragility due to their abnormal shape and membrane characteristics under stress but display low osmotic fragility because they are less prone to rupture in varying osmotic conditions compared to normal red blood cells.

questions.text: Which of the following statements are correct regarding mechanisms of depolarization, Repolarization, and hyperpolarization in a skeletal muscle action potential?( INICET May 2020) Depolarization due to influx of Na+ through voltage-gated channels Depolarization due to influx of Na+ through ligand-gated channels Repolarization due to efflux of K+ through a voltage-gated channel Repolarization due to efflux of K+ through a ligand-gated channel Hyperpolarization due to efflux of K+
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) 1, 3 and 5 are correct

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In skeletal muscle action potential, depolarization occurs due to the influx of Na+ through voltage-gated channels, repolarization occurs due to the efflux of K+ through voltage-gated channels, and hyperpolarization is caused by the prolonged efflux of K+.

questions.text: A 2-day-old full-term neonate is brought to the emergency department with repeated episodes of seizures since birth. The infant's seizures are clonic and multifocal, occurring within the first few hours of life, and have been refractory to standard anticonvulsant therapy. The baby was born via spontaneous vaginal delivery with no complications, and the pregnancy was uneventful. A genetic mutation affecting enzyme function has been identified, impairing the breakdown of certain metabolites. Which vitamin deficiency is most likely contributing to these neonatal seizures?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B. Vitamin B6 (Pyridoxine)

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Pyridoxine deficiency can cause refractory neonatal seizures, often manifesting within hours of birth. It is caused by an ALDH7A1 gene mutation that impairs enzymatic breakdown processes essential for brain function. Early recognition and supplementation of Vitamin B6 are critical in managing this condition.

questions.text: Proteoglycan present in glomerular basement membrane?(NEET PG 2020)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Heparan Sulfate

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ GAGs (Location and Function)
  • ➤ GAGs (Location and Function)
  • ➤ Ref- Harper 31st ed pg – 602
  • ➤ Ref- Harper 31st ed pg – 602

questions.text: Which of the following is an adverse effect with the long-term use of intermittent teriparatide for treatment of osteoporosis?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Osteosarcoma

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In summary, the most significant potential adverse effect associated with the long-term use of teriparatide is the development of osteosarcoma, albeit this risk is based primarily on animal studies. Therefore, clinicians are advised to limit the duration of teriparatide therapy and monitor patients closely.

questions.text: A 53-year-old man was admitted with history of a cerebrovascular accident 2 days ago. The patient is drowsy with minimal response. CT findings is shown in the image below. What will be your next line of management? (AIIMS MAY 2017)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Decompressive surgery

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The cases of significant cerebral edema with midline shift, as seen on CT in acute stroke settings, decompressive surgery is often necessary to prevent fatal outcomes and manage increased intracranial pressure effectively.

questions.text: When a codon is changed to stop codon, then it is: (NEET PG 2022)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Non-sense mutation

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:

References:

  • ↳ Reference : Harper’s 31 st ed/pg- 396

questions.text: Which of these options is not a mechanism contributing to thalidomide's teratogenic effects? ( INICET MAY 2023)

options.label: A
options.text: Release of reactive oxygen species and free radicles

questions.correct_answer: D. Inhibition of IL2, IL4, IL5
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Inhibition of IL2, IL4, IL5

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Thalidomide’s teratogenicity is primarily due to oxidative stress, inhibition of angiogenesis, and binding to cereblon, rather than the inhibition of interleukins IL2, IL4, and IL5.

questions.text: A 40-year-old male chronic smoker presents to the AIIMS OPD with fever, fatigue, yellow-colored urine, and RUQ pain. For the past few days, he has developed an aversion to eating food. On examination icterus was present. What investigations would you advise to rule out acute viral hepatitis? (AIIMS MAY 2018) Liver function test results are given below: Total Bilirubin 18.5 Direct Bilirubin 10.5 SGOT/AST 723 SGPT/ALT 812

options.label: A
options.text: HBsAg, IgM anti-HBc, Anti-HCV, Anti HEV

options.label: C
options.text: HBsAg, IgM anti-HBc, Anti-HDV, Anti-HEV, Anti-HCV

questions.correct_answer: B. Anti-HAV, HBsAg, IgM anti-HBc, Anti-HCV
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Anti-HAV, HBsAg, IgM anti-HBc, Anti-HCV

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In cases of suspected acute viral hepatitis with significant liver enzyme elevation and icterus, it's essential to conduct a thorough serological evaluation to determine the specific type of hepatitis virus involved. This allows for targeted management and appropriate precautions to prevent transmission.

References:

  • ↳ Reference: Harrison/gastroenterology/Viral Hepatitis/Chap 339

questions.text: The pretracheal layer of deep cervical fascia encloses all of the following except?(INICET May 2020)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B. Sternocleidomastoid

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The sternocleidomastoid muscle (SCM) is not enclosed by the pretracheal fascia. Instead, the SCM is associated with the superficial layer of the deep cervical fascia (also known as the investing layer). This layer of the fascia envelops both the sternocleidomastoid and trapezius muscles, acting as an investing layer for these superficial neck muscles.

questions.text: What is the diagnosis seen in the image below? NEET PG 2019
questions.explanation:
Ans. B. Candidal intertrigo

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Candidal intertrigo can be identified by the classic presentation of erythema, maceration , and possible white exudate in skin folds , such as the web spaces between fingers, distinguishing it from conditions that affect the nail folds, feet, or involve widespread skin desquamation.
  • ➤ Candidal intertrigo
  • ➤ erythema, maceration
  • ➤ white exudate in skin folds
  • ➤ web spaces

References:

  • ↳ Reference
  • ↳ :
  • ↳ Rook's Textbook of Dermatology 9th edition Chapter 32, Page nos 32.61-32.63

questions.text: Match the following? (INICET MAY 2022)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) A-4, B-1, C-2, D-3

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Each infectious disease has a specific staining technique for identification: Malaria (Giemsa stain), Tuberculosis (ZN stain), Leprosy (Fite Faraco stain), and Actinomycosis (Gram stain).

questions.text: Which of the following is true about the pathogenesis of Hirschsprung disease? (NEET PG 2020)

options.label: A
options.text: Failure of migration of neural crest cells

questions.correct_answer: A. Failure of migration of neural crest cells
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Failure of migration of neural crest cells

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Hirschsprung disease is primarily caused by the failure of neural crest cells to migrate to the bowel wall during embryonic development, resulting in aganglionosis in the distal bowel and leading to functional obstruction and proximal bowel dilation.

questions.text: A 10-year-old child presented with cola colored urine and had a history of skin infection few days back. His creatinine value was initially 2.5 mg/dl but even after 3 weeks of treatment it increased to 4.5 mg/dl. Which of the following is a likely kidney biopsy finding on electron microscopy? (NEET PG 2023)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Crescents in glomeruli

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The presence of crescents in the glomeruli on kidney biopsy is characteristic of rapidly progressive glomerulonephritis (RPGN), especially in a patient with worsening renal function following an episode of post-streptococcal glomerulonephritis.

questions.text: According to the CDC classification of bioterrorism agents, which one of the following statements is untrue? ( INICET MAY 2023)

options.label: A
options.text: Category A - Easily transmitted and are associated with high mortality rates

options.label: B
options.text: Category D - Re-emerging diseases that are high priority agents

options.label: C
options.text: Category C - Emerging diseases that are easy to disseminate and are associated with high mortality rates

options.label: D
options.text: Category B - Slow to disseminate and are associated with low mortality rates

questions.correct_answer: B. Category D - Re-emerging diseases that are high priority agents
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Category D - Re-emerging diseases that are high priority agents

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:

questions.text: During a journal club discussion on a randomized controlled trial comparing two surgical techniques for direct inguinal hernia, the reported p-value is 0.04. What is the most accurate interpretation of this p-value? (AIIMS MAY 2018)

options.label: A
options.text: Type II error is small and we can accept the findings of the study

options.label: B
options.text: The probability of false negative conclusion that operation A is better than B is 4%

options.label: C
options.text: The power of the study to detect the difference between operation A and B is 96%

options.label: D
options.text: The probability of a false positive conclusion that operation A is better than B is 4%

questions.correct_answer: D. The probability of a false positive conclusion that operation A is better than B is 4%
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) The probability of a false positive conclusion that operation A is better than B is 4%

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ A p-value of 0.04 suggests that there is a statistically significant difference, at the 5% significance level, between the surgical techniques being compared, assuming the risk of a false positive conclusion is acceptable at 4%.
  • ➤ A p-value of 0.04 suggests that there is a statistically significant difference, at the 5% significance level, between the surgical techniques being compared, assuming the risk of a false positive conclusion is acceptable at 4%.

questions.text: Which one of the following drugs inhibits neutrophil recruitment? (NEET PG 2019)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Colchicine

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Colchicine is the drug that inhibits neutrophil recruitment by disrupting microtubules, thus affecting neutrophil mobility and reducing inflammation. This mechanism makes it effective in treating conditions like gout and familial Mediterranean fever.

questions.text: A 4-year-old boy presents with painless, massive lower gastrointestinal bleeding. He is diagnosed with Meckel's diverticulum, and surgical treatment is planned. Which of the following is the most commonly encountered ectopic tissue in Meckel's diverticulum? ( INICET MAY 2022)
questions.explanation: Ans. A) Gastric and pancreatic

questions.text: A 2-year-old boy is brought to the clinic by his mother due to a history of loose stool. The mother denies any fever or blood in the stools but reports that the child is irritable and eagerly drinks water when offered. On examination, the child’s eyes are sunken, and the skin pinch test reveals slow retraction within two seconds. What is the most appropriate initial treatment for this child?

options.label: B
options.text: Oral rehydration therapy, zinc supplements, and breastfeeding

options.label: C
options.text: Continue usual feeding and give home fluids

options.label: D
options.text: Immediate referral to the hospital with intravenous fluids

questions.correct_answer: B. Oral rehydration therapy, zinc supplements, and breastfeeding
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Oral rehydration therapy, zinc supplements, and breastfeeding

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Children with some dehydration should be managed with oral rehydration therapy, zinc supplementation, and continued breastfeeding according to IMNCI guidelines to prevent progression to severe dehydration and aid in recovery.

questions.text: Which of the following does not favor euchromatin formation due to changes occurring at Cytosine residues at Cp islands in DNA?(AIIMS Nov 2018)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Methylation

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Methylation of cytosine residues at CpG islands is associated with gene silencing and the formation of transcriptionally inactive heterochromatin, thus not favoring euchromatin formation.

questions.text: A 25-year-old patient with a history of abdominal pain and fever for the past three days presents to the hospital. The physician orders a chest X-ray in the erect position which shows abnormal findings. Based on these findings, the most likely diagnosis will be determined? (NEET PG 2021)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Hollow viscus perforation

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Air under the diaphragm seen on an erect chest radiograph is a hallmark finding of a hollow viscus perforation, which is a surgical emergency requiring immediate attention to prevent peritonitis and other severe complications.
  • ➤ Air under the diaphragm seen on an erect chest radiograph is a hallmark finding of a hollow viscus perforation, which is a surgical emergency requiring immediate attention to prevent peritonitis and other severe complications.

questions.text: A 4-year-old child was brought to OPD with proptosis of left eye. On investigation, it was found to be a Desmin positive tumour. What can be the likely diagnosis? (AIIMS MAY 2021)
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Embryonal rhabdomyosarcoma, a common pediatric soft tissue sarcoma, is typically Desmin-positive and can present with proptosis, particularly when it arises in the orbit.
  • ➤ Ref: Robbins and Cotran pathologic basis of disease 8 th edition pg 2435-2437
  • ➤ Ref: Robbins and Cotran pathologic basis of disease 8 th edition pg 2435-2437

questions.text: Which of the following hormones is exclusively secreted by adrenal gland but not by the ovaries of females? (AIIMS May 2019)
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) DHEA-S

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ DHEA-S (dehydroepiandrosterone sulfate) is exclusively secreted by the adrenal glands and not by the ovaries because the ovaries lack the enzyme necessary to produce DHEA-S.

questions.text: Which of the following is True regarding drugs used for viral infections? Treatment of HCV with ribavirin is considered better than sofosbuvir Ombitasvir is inhibitor of proteins synthesis Imiquimod is used for Condyloma acuminata Simprevir inhibits protease of hepatitis C Oseltamivir is used for swine flu
questions.explanation:
Ans. A. C, D and E

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Sofosbuvir is preferred over ribavirin for HCV treatment due to better efficacy, ombitasvir is an NS5A inhibitor, imiquimod is used for condyloma acuminata, simprevir inhibits HCV protease, and oseltamivir is used for swine flu.

References:

  • ↳ Reference: KDT 8th/. 853,856,858

questions.text: A 3-day-old full-term neonate is brought to the emergency department due to yellow discoloration of the skin noticed since the second day of life. The infant is otherwise healthy, feeding well, and shows no signs of distress. Physical examination confirms jaundice involving the face and trunk. Laboratory studies reveal elevated total bilirubin levels with a predominance of indirect (unconjugated) bilirubin. The medical team initiates phototherapy to manage the condition and prevent complications. What is the primary effect of phototherapy on bilirubin?

options.label: A
options.text: Facilitates conversion of bilirubin to a conjugated form

options.label: B
options.text: Changes bilirubin into a soluble isomer that is excreted via the kidneys

options.label: D
options.text: Modifies intestinal flora to aid in bilirubin elimination

questions.correct_answer: B. Changes bilirubin into a soluble isomer that is excreted via the kidneys
questions.explanation:
Ans.  B) Changes bilirubin into a soluble isomer that is excreted via the kidneys

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Phototherapy reduces bilirubin levels in neonatal jaundice by converting unconjugated bilirubin into lumirubin, a water-soluble form that can be excreted by the kidneys. This process helps prevent bilirubin toxicity and complications such as kernicterus.

questions.text: Identify the correct statement regarding immune surveillance? ( AIIMS NOV 2020)

options.label: A
options.text: Anti CTLA 4 Ab is a new modality in the treatment of advanced cancers

options.label: B
options.text: Mutation of tumor suppressor genes decreases antigen toxicity

options.label: C
options.text: PD1/ PDL1 activation leading to tumor suppression

options.label: D
options.text: Binding of CD28 leads to immune tolerance

questions.correct_answer: A. Anti CTLA 4 Ab is a new modality in the treatment of advanced cancers
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Anti CTLA 4 Ab is a new modality in the treatment of advanced cancers

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Anti-CTLA-4 antibodies like Ipilimumab are a new modality in the treatment of advanced cancers, enhancing the anti-tumor immune response by blocking inhibitory signals to T cells.
  • ➤ Anti-CTLA-4 antibodies
  • ➤ Ref: Robbin and Cotran pathologic basis of disease 8th edition pg 574
  • ➤ Ref:
  • ➤ Robbin and Cotran pathologic basis of disease 8th edition pg 574

questions.text: A drug was given IV at a rate of 1.6 mg/min. The clearance of the drug is 640 ml/min. The half-life of the drug is 1.8 hour. Calculate the plasma concentration of the drug?( AIIMS Nov 2017)
questions.explanation:
Ans. D. 0.002mg/ml

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ When given the rate of infusion and clearance, the steady-state plasma concentration of a drug can be calculated using the formula:
  • ➤ Plasma concentration (C)=Rate of infusion (R)/ Clearance (Cl)

questions.text: A 20-year-old girl presents with primary amenorrhea. On examination breasts were found to be poorly developed, vagina was present. Ultrasound revealed a normal uterus, but gonads weren't detected. Further evaluation done showed 46XY karyotype. The most probable diagnosis? (INICET NOV 2018)
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Swyer's syndrome

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Swyer syndrome (46XY gonadal dysgenesis) is a condition where individuals with a 46XY karyotype present phenotypically as females with primary amenorrhea, poorly developed secondary sexual characteristics, and a normal uterus but lack functioning gonads.
  • ➤ Ref: Dutta’s textbook of gynecology 6 th edition pg 33446, Williams textbook of gynecology 3 rd edition pg373
  • ➤ Ref: Dutta’s textbook of gynecology 6 th edition pg 33446, Williams textbook of gynecology 3 rd edition pg373

questions.text: Choose the correctly matched pairs regarding the drugs used in schizophrenia:( INICET Nov 2022)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Antipsychotic drugs manage schizophrenia by targeting various neurotransmitter systems. D2 antagonism helps reduce positive symptoms, while 5HT2A antagonism improves negative symptoms. Muscarinic receptor antagonism can help mitigate extrapyramidal side effects. Misconceptions about receptor effects, such as 5HT1A agonism causing weight loss, need to be corrected.
  • ➤ Antipsychotic drugs

questions.text: A patient who is a known case of cirrhosis of the liver presents with abdominal distension and swelling of the lower limbs. The preferred diuretic for this patient would be?( INICET Nov 2021)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B. Eplerenone

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Eplerenone, as a mineralocorticoid receptor antagonist and potassium-sparing diuretic, is the preferred choice for managing ascites and peripheral edema in patients with cirrhosis due to its ability to counteract the effects of elevated aldosterone levels.

questions.text: A 28-year-old public health nurse is attending a seminar on primary prevention strategies. She needs to identify interventions that fall under specific protection, a subset of primary prevention. Which of the following interventions does NOT come under the primary level of prevention for specific protection? (AIIMS NOV 2019)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Hand washing

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Hand washing is a health promotion measure and does not fall under specific protection in primary prevention strategies. Note - Chinese Medicine is the Pioneer in concept of ‘Specific protection by vaccine’
  • ➤ Hand washing is a health promotion measure and does not fall under specific protection in primary prevention strategies.
  • ➤ Note - Chinese Medicine is the Pioneer in concept of ‘Specific protection by vaccine’

questions.text: You work as a medical officer in a Primary Health Center (PHC). You are tasked with developing a strategy to address widespread anemia in the community. Considering the need for efficacy, safety, and ease of administration, which of the following options would you recommend for the prevention and treatment of anemia in this setting? (INICET NOV 2020)

options.label: A
options.text: FeSO4 + Vit C + Folate + Vit B12

questions.correct_answer: A. FeSO4 + Vit C + Folate + Vit B12
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) FeSO4 + Vit C + Folate + Vit B12

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The comprehensive and cost-effective approach, including FeSO4 + Vitamin C + Folate + Vitamin B12, is preferable for the widespread prevention and treatment of anemia in a community setting, especially in a resource-limited Primary Health Center (PHC).
  • ➤ The comprehensive and cost-effective approach, including FeSO4 + Vitamin C + Folate + Vitamin B12, is preferable for the widespread prevention and treatment of anemia in a community setting, especially in a resource-limited Primary Health Center (PHC).

questions.text: Anuj has been diagnosed with diphtheria and is being treated in the ward. His 3-year-old brother, Ajay who lives in the same house has received vaccination against diphtheria about 16 months back. What is the next best step for the management of the younger sibling, Ajay? (NEET PG 2020)

options.label: B
options.text: Nothing as the child is already exposed

questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Erythromycin only

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ For a close contact of a diphtheria patient who has received the diphtheria vaccination within the last five years, antibiotic prophylaxis with erythromycin is the appropriate management step.

questions.text: A child with IQ of 50 comes under: (FMGE DEC 2020)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Mild MR

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Mild intellectual disability is defined as an IQ range of 50-70, and children with mild intellectual disability can often live independently with some support.
